243169A0DFE60131711868A86D17958E.description: List practices and products that make living safer

24311830DFE60131711768A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Public Health students will

2430BC30DFE60131711668A86D17958E.description: Identify ways the physical environment is related to individual and community health

24306EC0DFE60131711568A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Social Factors students will

24301720DFE60131711468A86D17958E.description: List the jobs carried out by people at school and in the community that support health and success in school
comments: Invite community helpers to speak about the contribution of their occupation to community and/or public health and answer questions from students

242FC9A0DFE60131711368A86D17958E.description: Through the study of School and Community Efforts students will

comments: Students will learn the influence of social factors on health, the contribution of public health, and will gain skills to promote health and to collaborate with others to facilitate healthy, safe, and supportive communities.

242F2740DFE60131711168A86D17958E.description: Describe how business, industry, and individuals can work cooperatively to solve ecological health problems, such as conserving natural resources and decreasing pollution
comments: Working with family volunteers, students clean up school grounds and plant flowers and other plants that help clean the air (such as spider plant or peace lily). Take before and after pictures and display

242ECD90DFE60131711068A86D17958E.description: Describe types of natural resources and their connection with health

242E8240DFE60131710F68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Interdependence students will

comments: Students will gain knowledge of the interdependence between the environment and physical health, and will acquire skills to care for the environment.

242DCB50DFE60131710D68A86D17958E.description: Name and weigh criteria for selecting a consumer product and evaluate the product's safety and health aspects

242D39C0DFE60131710C68A86D17958E.description: Identify resources used by individuals to manage their daily lives (such as time and money)
comments: Students use scenarios of good or poor choices made by children using time or money resources. Discuss reasons why those choices were appropriate or inappropriate and if inappropriate, what choices could be made instead

242BEAF0DFE60131710A68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Resource Management Practices students will

242B9F20DFE60131710968A86D17958E.description: Interpret the symbols and information provided on labels for health care products and food products

242AF870DFE60131710768A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Health Care students will

comments: Students will acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to obtain, manage, and evaluate resources to maintain physical and mental health and well being for themselves, their family, and the community.

Personal and Community Health includes those aspects of health most often related to our larger community and world. The knowledge and skills presented in this Strand lay the groundwork for participation in preserving and improving our surroundings and for dealing with future health-related events. The contribution of Public Health is addressed in this Strand.

2429FF70DFE60131710468A86D17958E.description: Identify helping resources regarding violence in the school and community, such as counselors, neighbors, law enforcement, and members of faith-based groups

2429AA60DFE60131710368A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between one's personal rights and those of others and use communication and problem-solving to set personal boundaries, resolve conflicts, and develop positive relationships
comments: Using scenarios involving conflict and violence, students discuss the best strategy for resolving a particular situation (such as avoiding strangers, walking or running away, telling someone to stop, asking for help from trusted adults, encouraging others to walk away

24295410DFE60131710268A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Alternatives students will

2428FC00DFE60131710168A86D17958E.description: Identify factors (such as internal character and personality attributes and forces external to individuals, such as the media or society) related to both violent and nonviolent attitudes

2428A0C0DFE60131710068A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Contributing Factors students will

24284400DFE6013170FF68A86D17958E.description: Describe some of the ways that young children can be intentionally helpful and intentionally hurtful to one another

2427ECC0DFE6013170FE68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Awareness students will

comments: Students will learn how their actions affect others, will understand the power that positive character traits can have in violence prevention, will gain skills to report incidents of violence and hurtful behavior to adults in the school and community, will avoid engaging in violence, and will identify constructive alternatives to violence, including how to discourage others from engaging in violence.

24273FF0DFE6013170FC68A86D17958E.description: Identify whom to seek help from for a possible poisoning or overdose

2426E0C0DFE6013170FB68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Healthy Decisions students will

24266710DFE6013170FA68A86D17958E.description: Describe how tobacco and prolonged exposure to cigarette smoke affects the body

24260BF0DFE6013170F968A86D17958E.description: Describe the purpose of medicines (prescription and over-the-counter) and how they can be used or misused in the treatment of common medical problems

comments: Students sort pictures of food products, beverages, medicines, and vitamins into three categories-Safe to Eat, Not Safe to Eat, Things I Need to Ask About
2425B3D0DFE6013170F868A86D17958E.description: Identify and distinguish between substances that are safe and unsafe to be taken by mouth

24255CE0DFE6013170F768A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Effects on the Body students will

comments: Students will acquire the knowledge and skills to be competent in making health-enhancing decisions regarding the use of medications and avoidance of substances, and in communicating about substance use/abuse prevention for healthier homes, schools, and communities.

2424B9A0DFE6013170F568A86D17958E.description: Apply appropriate first aid for cuts and bruises, including observing universal precautions

24244B40DFE6013170F468A86D17958E.description: Follow universal precautions for all first aid involving any blood and other body fluids

2423E6A0DFE6013170F368A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Emergency Intervention students will

242385A0DFE6013170F268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the use of assertive behavior, refusal skills, and actions intended for personal safety
comments: Students role-play ways to deal with bullying, teasing, and name-calling, and how to get away from threatening strangers

24232810DFE6013170F168A86D17958E.description: Distinguish among safe, unsafe, and inappropriate touch

2422D770DFE6013170F068A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Self Protection students will

24228060DFE6013170EF68A86D17958E.description: Describe personal responsibility for reducing hazards and avoiding accidents
comments: Students develop a checklist of safety labels and features for helmets, sports equipment, and toys, and evaluate their possessions for safety

24222460DFE6013170EE68A86D17958E.description: Name persons and community helpers (such as police officers, fire fighters, and emergency medical personnel) who can be contacted to help with health, safety, and injury prevention and describe the appropriate procedures for contacting healthcare personnel in an emergency
comments: Students role-play calling the operator, 911, or police, and giving name, address, and other information regarding an emergency. Discuss the circumstances under which not to call (such as a prank)

2421D910DFE6013170ED68A86D17958E.description: List rules for fire safety, weapons safety, bus safety, and seatbelt use where applicable, such as at home, school, community, and play, and explain why the rules are important

24218B80DFE6013170EC68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Hazard Prevention students will

comments: Students will gain the knowledge and skills to administer first aid and carry out emergency procedures, including cardiopulmonary resuscitation, will avoid, recognize, and report verbal, physical, and emotional abuse situations, and will assess the factors that contribute to intentional and unintentional injury, including motor vehicle accidents, fire safety, and weapons safety.

2420DB90DFE6013170EA68A86D17958E.description: Identify tooth functions and causes of tooth health and decay, and apply proper dental health skills (such as choosing healthy tooth snacks, brushing, flossing)
comments: Using a large cardboard model of the mouth with the teeth labeled, students close their eyes and floss with yarn covered with colored chalk. Students open their eyes and see which teeth were and were not missed. Practice until flossing is complete

24207990DFE6013170E968A86D17958E.description: Apply skills to prevent and control the spread of disease, including those that help promote cleanliness (such as correct handwashing, regular bathing, and washing clothes)
comments: Invite the school nurse or school physician to present a program to students about the relationship between hand washing and catching a cold and medicines that may help, including that medicines should only be taken with adult supervision

24201AA0DFE6013170E868A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Health Maintenance students will

241FCC70DFE6013170E768A86D17958E.description: Identify the common symptoms of illness and recognize that being responsible for individual health means alerting caretakers to any symptoms of illness

241F7910DFE6013170E668A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Signs, Causes, and Treatment students will

241F2280DFE6013170E568A86D17958E.description: Describe how the body fights germs and disease naturally and with medicines and immunization

241EC7C0DFE6013170E468A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Prevention students will

comments: Students will learn the signs, causes, and treatment of chronic and communicable diseases, and will gain skills related to health promotion, disease prevention, and health maintenance.

Safety and Prevention includes those aspects of health most often related to risky and dangerous behaviors and conduct that can have negative life-long consequences on health. The topics are of particular importance for young people who are at the age when many of these behaviors are being contemplated. The knowledge and skills presented in the Personal Safety Strand provide a means for young people to avoid risky behavior, now and in the future, so that they can lead healthier lives.

241DB4C0DFE6013170E168A86D17958E.description: Describe the concepts of prejudice and discrimination

241D6640DFE6013170E068A86D17958E.description: Describe the concept of friendship and contrast qualities that strengthen or weaken a friendship, including the importance of sound character in interacting with others

241D0AD0DFE6013170DF68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Peer Relationships students will

241CBD10DFE6013170DE68A86D17958E.description: Apply both verbal and non-verbal communication skills to develop positive relationships and improve the social environment of the school
comments: Students design posters, bulletin boards or web page components on the theme of the 3R's- Responsibilities, Rights, and Respect. Include examples of conduct and policies that reflect the 3R's in the school

241C6FA0DFE6013170DD68A86D17958E.description: Explain why communication is essential in human relationships and identify people from whom children can learn how to communicate, such as family members, friends, community members, and members of faith-based groups

241C1FD0DFE6013170DC68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Communication students will

comments: Students will learn that relationships with others are an integral part of the human life experience and the factors that contribute to healthy interpersonal relationships, and will acquire skills to enhance and make many of these relationships more fulfilling through commitment and communication.

241B7440DFE6013170DA68A86D17958E.description: Identify what parents do to provide a safe, healthy environment for their children

241B0620DFE6013170D968A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Parenting students will

241AB640DFE6013170D868A86D17958E.description: Identify whom to talk with about family problems and successes

241A6E90DFE6013170D768A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Supports students will

241A2360DFE6013170D668A86D17958E.description: Describe factors, such as character traits of individuals and life events, that can strengthen families
comments: As a class, design a bulletin board collage on the many different things adults know and are able to do. Discuss why a person with these skills, experiences, talents, and information would be a good person to talk to when you have a problem or have experienced a success

2419D890DFE6013170D568A86D17958E.description: Describe different types of families, addressing membership and social influences, and the functions of family members

24198BA0DFE6013170D468A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Functions and Purpose students will

comments: Students will gain knowledge about the significance of the family on individuals and society, and will learn skills to support the family, balance work and family life, be an effective parent, and nurture the development of children.

2418E420DFE6013170D268A86D17958E.description: Explain how coping skills (such as perceiving situations as opportunities, taking action/exerting control where possible) positively influence self-concept

24189840DFE6013170D168A86D17958E.description: Explain and practice a model for decision-making that includes gathering information, predicting outcomes, listing advantages and disadvantages, identifying moral implications, and evaluating decisions
comments: Students design a poster showing the steps used to solve a problem and post it in the classroom

24184960DFE6013170D068A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Decision Making students will

2417FBD0DFE6013170CF68A86D17958E.description: Describe the effects of leadership skills on the promotion of teamwork

2417AC60DFE6013170CE68A86D17958E.description: Define character traits such as honesty, trustworthiness, self-discipline, respectfulness, and kindness and describe their contribution to identity, self-concept, decision-making, and interpersonal relationships

24175440DFE6013170CD68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Identity students will

2416F640DFE6013170CC68A86D17958E.description: Apply methods to accommodate a variety of feelings in a constructive manner in order to promote well being

24169690DFE6013170CB68A86D17958E.description: Identify the various feelings that most people experience and describe the physical and emotional reactions of the body to intense positive and negative feelings
comments: Students draw a picture of their family members after the birth of an additional family member and give an oral interpretation in small groups

24163660DFE6013170CA68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Feelings and Emotions students will

comments: Students will acquire knowledge about emotions and physical health, the management of emotions, personality and character development, and social awareness; and will learn skills to promote self-acceptance, make decisions, and cope with stress, including suicide prevention.

Social and Emotional Health includes those aspects of health that are particularly unique to human beings, namely being aware of ourselves, both as individuals and as members of social groups. The knowledge and skills presented in this Strand address and support our ability to interact with others in positive and socially acceptable ways.

24152DC0DFE6013170C768A86D17958E.description: Recognize that diet, exercise, rest, and avoidance of risk behaviors such as smoking, drinking, and other substance use contribute to the health of a mother and fetus
comments: Students write short answers to define the types of sexual orientation

2414E350DFE6013170C668A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Wellness students will

24149740DFE6013170C568A86D17958E.description: Define sexual orientation using the correct terminology (such as heterosexual, and gay and lesbian)

24144A70DFE6013170C468A86D17958E.description: Identify the physical changes as related to the reproductive system during puberty
comments: Invite the school nurse or a health care professional who specializes in children to discuss the changes that take place in boys and girls at puberty

2413F880DFE6013170C368A86D17958E.description: Identify the components, functions, and processes of the reproductive system
comments: Students label the functions and/or systems of the reproductive system on a blank diagram

2413A0C0DFE6013170C268A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Development students will

comments: Students will acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to make effective personal decisions that promote their emotional, sexual, and reproductive health.

2412F360DFE6013170C068A86D17958E.description: Describe how food choices are influenced by availability, individual and family preferences, media, and background, and identify healthy foods within various social groups

2412A810DFE6013170BF68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Social Influences students will

24125730DFE6013170BE68A86D17958E.description: Describe personal hygiene and safety measures used in preparing foods

2411F870DFE6013170BD68A86D17958E.description: Identify the connection between food served in the home with regional food production
comments: Students interview a person in the home who prepares food to determine how food choices change according to season

2411A260DFE6013170BC68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Safe and Adequate Food Supply students will

241149B0DFE6013170BB68A86D17958E.description: Identify heredity, diet, and physical activity as key factors in body shape and size

2410F8B0DFE6013170BA68A86D17958E.description: Recognize hunger and satiety cues and how to make food decisions based upon these cues
comments: Sponsor a potluck lunch in the class and ask students to select and eat servings one at a time so that they eat slowly until their appetite is satisfied. Ask them to pay attention to their feelings of hunger and satiety. Students discuss their experiences

241086F0DFE6013170B968A86D17958E.description: Use the USDA Food Guide Pyramid and its three major concepts of balance, variety, and moderation to plan healthy meals and snacks

240A70D0DFE6013170B868A86D17958E.description: Identify the key nutrients in food that support healthy body systems (skeletal, circulatory) and recognize that the amount of food needed changes as the body grows

240A05C0DFE6013170B768A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Improving Nutrition students will

comments: Students will gain the knowledge and skills to select a diet that supports health and reduces the risk of illness and future chronic diseases.

24094870DFE6013170B568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate responsible personal and social conduct used in physical activity settings

2408D250DFE6013170B468A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Personal and Social Competency students will

24086590DFE6013170B368A86D17958E.description: Identify the major behaviors that contribute to wellness (exercise, nutrition, hygiene, rest, and recreation, refraining from using tobacco, alcohol, and other substances)

24081960DFE6013170B268A86D17958E.description: Explain the benefits of physical fitness to good health and increased active lifestyle

2407CC30DFE6013170B168A86D17958E.description: Identify physical and psychological changes that result from participation in a variety of physical activities

24077EC0DFE6013170B068A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Fitness students will

24072F00DFE6013170AF68A86D17958E.description: Perform rhythm routines, including dancing, to demonstrate fundamental movement skills

2406DCE0DFE6013170AE68A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of manipulative (throwing, catching, striking), locomotor (walking, running, skipping, hopping, galloping, sliding, jumping, leaping), and non-locomotor (twisting, balancing, extending) skills as individuals and in teams

24067DD0DFE6013170AD68A86D17958E.description: Apply movement concepts including direction, balance, level (high, low), pathway (straight, curve, zigzag), range (expansive, narrow), and force absorption (rigid, with bent knees) to extend versatility and improve physical performance
comments: In pairs, students practice throwing and catching different objects, then hitting a target. Observe partner and use movement concepts to provide feedback

24062CC0DFE6013170AC68A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Motor Skill Development students will

comments: Students will, by repeated practice, acquire and refine a variety of manipulative, locomotor, and non-locomotor movement skills, and will utilize principles of training and conditioning, will learn biomechanics and exercise physiology, and will apply the concept of wellness to their lives.

24058E30DFE6013170AA68A86D17958E.description: List the stages in the basic growth process of living organisms (fertilization, growth, reproduction, and death)

24053480DFE6013170A968A86D17958E.description: Distinguish the characteristics of living and non-living organisms.

2404D7E0DFE6013170A868A86D17958E.description: Identify appropriate accommodations and aids for people with physical disabilities
comments: For example, students tour the school to determine all wheelchair accessible features and create a map of the school with these features labeled that can be displayed in the school

24046A20DFE6013170A768A86D17958E.description: Identify behaviors and environmental factors that influence functioning of body systems

24041AF0DFE6013170A668A86D17958E.description: Name the external and internal parts of the body and the body systems (nervous, muscular, skeletal, circulatory, respiratory, digestive, endocrine, and excretory systems)

2403CBE0DFE6013170A568A86D17958E.description: Through the study of Body Systems students will

comments: Students will learn the basic characteristics of physical growth and development, including body functions and systems throughout the life cycle, and will acquire skills to promote and maintain positive growth and development.

Physical Health includes those aspects of health that are often the most salient in our immediate lives and related closely to the natural progression inherent in human development. The knowledge and skills presented are the foundation for individual control over many of the factors related to a healthy lifestyle. The areas covered share common goals in their emphasis and focus on building and maintaining healthy habits.
